Class TextFileInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • TextFileInput

  • public class TextFileInput
extends java.lang.Object
    Simplified buffered character input stream from an input text file. Manages an input text file, handling all IOExceptions by generating RuntimeExcpetions (run-time error messages). If the text file cannot be created, a RuntimeException is thrown, which by default results an an error message being printed to the standard error stream.
    Author:
    D. Nixon

    • Constructor Detail

      • TextFileInput

        public TextFileInput(java.lang.String filename)
        Creates a buffered character input strea, for the specified text file.
        Parameters:
        filename - the input text file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if an IOException is thrown when attempting to open the file.

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes this character input stream. No more characters can be read from this TextFileInput once it is closed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the file is already closed.
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if an IOException is thrown when closing the file.

      • readLine

        public java.lang.String readLine()
        Reads a line of text from the file and positions cursor at 0 for the next line. Reads from the current cursor position to end of line. Implementation does not invoke read.
        Returns:
        the line of text, with end-of-line marker deleted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if an IOException is thrown when attempting to read from the file.

      • getLineCount

        public int getLineCount()
        Returns a count of lines read from the file so far.

      • isOneOf

        public static boolean isOneOf(char toBeChecked,
                              char[] options)
        Tests whether the specified character is equal, ignoring case, to one of the specified options.
        Parameters:
        toBeChecked - the character to be tested.
        options - a set of characters
        Returns:
        true if toBeChecked is equal, ignoring case, to one of the options, false otherwise.

      • isOneOf

        public static boolean isOneOf(java.lang.String toBeChecked,
                              java.lang.String[] options)
        Tests whether the specified string is one of the specified options. Checks whether the string contains the same sequence of characters (ignoring case) as one of the specified options.
        Parameters:
        toBeChecked - the String to be tested
        options - a set of Strings
        Returns:
        true if toBeChecked contains the same sequence of characters, ignoring case, as one of the options, false otherwise.

      • readSelection

        public java.lang.String readSelection(java.lang.String[] options)
        Reads a line from the text file and ensures that it matches one of a specified set of options.
        Parameters:
        options - array of permitted replies
        Returns:
        the line of text, if it contains the same sequence of characters (ignoring case for letters) as one of the specified options, null otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the line of text does not match any of the specified options, or if an IOException is thrown when reading from the file.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if no options are provided, or if the end of the file has been reached.

      • readBooleanSelection

        public boolean readBooleanSelection()
        Reads a line from the text file and ensures that it matches, ignoring case, one of "Y", "N", "yes", "no", "1", "0", "T", "F", "true", or "false". There must be no additional characters on the line.
        Returns:
        true if the line matches "Y", "yes", "1" "T", or "true". false if the line matches "N", "no", "0", "F", or "false".
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the line of text does not match one of "Y", "N", "yes", "no", "1", "0", "T", "F", "true", or "false", or if an IOException is thrown when reading from the file.
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the end of the file has been reached.
